titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4138) to protect the separation of powers in the Constitution of the United States by ensuring that the President takes care that the laws be faithfully executed, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3973) to amend section 530D of title 28, United States Code.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-378, by Mr. Nugent.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4138 and H.R. 3973. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 90.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 511.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 227 - 190 (Roll no. 118).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 229 - 192 (Roll no. 119).

bill.summary: 3/11/2014--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4138) to protect the separation of powers in the Constitution of the United States by ensuring that the President takes care that the laws be faithfully executed, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3973) to amend section 530D of title 28, United States Code.
